title: TCS employees receive IT demands up to Rs 1.45 lakh; firm asks them to wait
description: TCS had in an internal memo on Tuesday had said it understood some employees have received income-tax demand notices and that it had taken up the matter with the tax authorities for fast resolution.
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) employees have received income-tax demands varying from Rs 50,000 to Rs 1.45 lakh even as the IT major asked them not to pay till the time it gets a clarification from the department, people aware of the development told ET.The number of employees that received notices could range between a couple of thousands to about 30,000 employees, they said.Questions mailed to TCS seeking comment did not elicit any response till the time of going to press.Also Read: Got income tax demand notice due to errors in Form 26AS, AIS like TCS employees? How taxpayers can respond to itPeople cited above said the companyâ€™s HR team in an internal mail has requested employees not to pay taxes till the time the differences are sorted out. According to them, the matter pertains to tax deduction at source (TDS) for the fourth quarter of fiscal 2024.
